Explore (Digging In)

Providing for Individual Needs

Have students talk through using a number line and make sketches to show their thinking.

Suggest that students use what they know about working with chips and/or the number line to help them make predictions in the Initial Challenge and What If...? Situation A. Push students to show evidence of their conclusions.

Models help students make sense of operations like subtraction with integers. These experiences help them get ready to move toward a more abstract understanding of subtraction of integers. (Time)

Planning for the Summary

What evidence will you use in the summary to clarify and deepen understanding of the Now What Do You Know? question? What will you do if you do not have evidence?

Now What Do You Know?

Describe an algorithm for subtracting rational numbers. How does this compare to your algorithm for subtracting whole numbers?

(Look for ways students are connecting the models to number sentences. Look for how students are generalizing subtracting integers.)
